Account.description: Represents an individual account, which is an organization or person involved with your business (such as customers, competitors, and partners).

MasterRecordId.sfdc_description: Do not use this column unless dealing with deleted records. If this object was deleted as the result of a merge, this field contains the ID of the record that was kept. If this object was deleted for any other reason, or has not been deleted, the value is null.

Name.sfdc_description: Name of the account. If the account has a record type of Person Account: This value is the concatenation of the FirstName, MiddleName, LastName, and Suffix of the associated person contact.

Type.sfdc_description: Type and/or subtype of account, for example, Customer, Competitor, or Partner. It may have multiple semantically close subtypes of the same type, for example `Customer`, `Customer - Direct`, `Customer - Channel`, etc.

RecordTypeId.sfdc_description: ID of the record type assigned to this object.

ParentId.sfdc_description: ID of the parent object, if any.

BillingStreet.sfdc_description: Street address for the billing address of this account.

BillingCity.sfdc_description: City name of the billing address of this account.

BillingState.sfdc_description: State name of the billing address of this account.

BillingPostalCode.sfdc_description: Postal code of the billing address of this account.

BillingCountry.sfdc_description: Country name the billing address of this account.

BillingLatitude.sfdc_description: Used with BillingLongitude to specify the precise geolocation of a billing address.

BillingLongitude.sfdc_description: Used with BillingLatitude to specify the precise geolocation of a billing address.

BillingGeocodeAccuracy.sfdc_description: Accuracy level of the geocode for the billing address.

ShippingStreet.sfdc_description: The street address of the shipping address for this account.

ShippingCity.sfdc_description: City name of the shipping address for this account.

ShippingState.sfdc_description: State name of the shipping address for this account.

ShippingPostalCode.sfdc_description: Postal code of the shipping address for this account.

ShippingCountry.sfdc_description: Country name of the shipping address for this account.

ShippingLatitude.sfdc_description: Used with ShippingLongitude to specify the precise geolocation of a shipping address.

ShippingLongitude.sfdc_description: Used with ShippingLatitude to specify the precise geolocation of an address.

ShippingGeocodeAccuracy.sfdc_description: Accuracy level of the geocode for the shipping address.

AccountNumber.sfdc_description: Account number assigned to this account (not the unique, system-generated ID assigned during creation).

PhotoUrl.sfdc_description: Path to be combined with the URL of a Salesforce instance (for example, https://yourInstance.salesforce.com/) to generate a URL to request the social network profile image associated with the account.

Industry.sfdc_description: An industry associated with this account.

AnnualRevenue.sfdc_description: Estimated annual revenue of the account. This is NOT OUR REVENUE made with the account! Do not use this field unless you explicitly need to use the amount of money the account makes as a business for themselves.

NumberOfEmployees.sfdc_description: Number of employees working at the company represented by this account.

Rating.sfdc_description: The account’s prospect rating, for example Hot, Warm, or Cold.

Site.sfdc_description: Account side name of the account’s location, for example Headquarters or London.

OwnerId.sfdc_description: The ID of the user who currently owns this account. Default value is the user logged in to the API to perform the create.

CreatedById.sfdc_description:
CreatedById (Id of the User who created this Account)
Id of User.

LastModifiedById.sfdc_description:
LastModifiedById (Id of the last User who modified this Account)
Id of User.

LastActivityDate.sfdc_description: Value is one of the following, whichever is the most recent: Due date of the most recent event logged against the record. Due date of the most recently closed task associated with the record.

LastViewedDate.sfdc_description: The timestamp when the current user last viewed this record or list view. If this value is null, the user might have only accessed this record or list view (LastReferencedDate) but not viewed it.

LastReferencedDate.sfdc_description: The timestamp when the current user last accessed this record, a record related to this record, or a list view.

Jigsaw.sfdc_description: References the ID of a company in Data.com. If an account has a value in this field, it means that the account was imported from Data.com. If the field value is null, the account was not imported from Data.com. This field is available on business accounts, not person accounts.

AccountSource.sfdc_description: The source of the account record.

SicDesc.sfdc_description: A brief description of an org’s line of business, based on its SIC code. This field is available on business accounts, not person accounts.

AccountHistory.description: Represents the history of changes to the values in the fields of an account.

CreatedById.sfdc_description:
CreatedById (Id of the User who created this AccountHistory)
Id of User.

Case.description: Represents a case, which is a customer issue or problem.

MasterRecordId.sfdc_description: Do not use this column unless dealing with deleted records. If this object was deleted as the result of a merge, this field contains the ID of the record that was kept. If this object was deleted for any other reason, or has not been deleted, the value is null.

CaseNumber.sfdc_description: Assigned automatically when each case is inserted. It can't be set directly, and it can't be modified after the case is created.

AccountId.sfdc_description: ID of the account associated with this case.

ParentId.sfdc_description: The ID of the parent case in the hierarchy.

SuppliedName.sfdc_description: The name that was entered when the case was created.

SuppliedEmail.sfdc_description: The email address that was entered when the case was created.. If no email address is in the contact record, the email specified here is used.

SuppliedPhone.sfdc_description: The phone number that was entered when the case was created.

SuppliedCompany.sfdc_description: The company name that was entered when the case was created..

Type.sfdc_description: The type of case, such as Feature Request or Question.

RecordTypeId.sfdc_description: ID of the record type assigned to this object.

Status.sfdc_description: The status of the case, such as New, Closed, or Escalated. This field directly controls the IsClosed flag. Each predefined Status value implies an IsClosed flag value. For more information, see CaseStatus.

Reason.sfdc_description: The reason why the case was created, such as Instructions not clear, or User didn’t attend training.

Origin.sfdc_description: The source of the case, such as Email, Phone, or Web.

Language.sfdc_description: The language of the case. This field is available in all Enterprise, Performance, and Unlimited orgs with the Service Cloud. Out of the box, it's used only by Einstein Case Classification.

Priority.sfdc_description: The importance or urgency of the case, such as High, Medium, or Low.

Description.sfdc_description: A text description of the case.

IsClosed.sfdc_description: Indicates whether the case is closed (true) or open (false). This field is controlled by the Status field; it can't be set directly.

ClosedDate.sfdc_description: The date and time when the case was closed.

IsEscalated.sfdc_description: Indicates whether the case has been escalated (true) or not. A case's escalated state does not affect how you can use a case, or whether you can query, delete, or update it.

OwnerId.sfdc_description: ID of the contact who owns the case.

SlaStartDate.sfdc_description: Shows the time that the case entered an entitlement process. If you have the Edit permission on cases, you can update or reset the time.

CreatedById.sfdc_description:
CreatedById (Id of the User who created this Case)
Id of User.

LastModifiedById.sfdc_description:
LastModifiedById (Id of the last User who modified this Case)
Id of User.

ContactMobile.sfdc_description: Mobile telephone number for the contact.

ContactEmail.sfdc_description: Email address for the contact. The Case.ContactEmail field displays the Email field on the contact that is referenced by Case.ContactId.

Comments.sfdc_description: Used to insert a new CaseComment.

LastViewedDate.sfdc_description: The timestamp when the current user last viewed this record or list view. If this value is null, the user might have only accessed this record or list view (LastReferencedDate) but not viewed it.

LastReferencedDate.sfdc_description: The timestamp when the current user last accessed this record, a record related to this record, or a list view.

ParentId.sfdc_description: ID of the parent Case of the CaseComment.

IsPublished.sfdc_description: Indicates whether the CaseComment is visible to customers in the Self-Service portal (true) or not (false).

CreatedById.sfdc_description:
CreatedById (Id of the User who created this CaseComment)
Id of User.

LastModifiedById.sfdc_description:
LastModifiedById (Id of the last User who modified this CaseComment)
Id of User.

CaseHistory.description: Represents historical information about changes that have been made to the associated Case.

CaseId.sfdc_description: ID of the Case associated with this record.

CreatedById.sfdc_description:
CreatedById (Id of the User who created this CaseHistory)
Id of User.

Field.sfdc_description: Name of the case field that was modified, or a special value to indicate some other modification to the case.

OldValue.sfdc_description: Previous value of the modified case field.

NewValue.sfdc_description: New value of the modified case field.

Contact.description: Represents a contact, which is a person associated with an account.

MasterRecordId.sfdc_description: Do not use this column unless dealing with deleted records. If this record was deleted as the result of a merge, this field contains the ID of the record that remains. If this record was deleted for any other reason, or has not been deleted, the value is null.

AccountId.sfdc_description: ID of the account that’s the parent of this contact.

Salutation.sfdc_description: Honorific abbreviation, word, or phrase to be used in front of name in greetings, such as Dr. or Mrs.

Name.sfdc_description: Concatenation of FirstName, MiddleName, LastName, and Suffix.

RecordTypeId.sfdc_description: ID of the record type assigned to this object.

OtherLatitude.sfdc_description: Used with OtherLongitude to specify the precise geolocation of an alternate address.

OtherLongitude.sfdc_description: Used with OtherLatitude to specify the precise geolocation of an alternate address.

OtherGeocodeAccuracy.sfdc_description: Accuracy level of the geocode for the other address.

MailingLatitude.sfdc_description: Used with MailingLongitude to specify the precise geolocation of a mailing address.

MailingLongitude.sfdc_description: Used with MailingLatitude to specify the precise geolocation of a mailing address.

MailingGeocodeAccuracy.sfdc_description: Accuracy level of the geocode for the mailing address.

ReportsToId.sfdc_description: This field doesn’t appear if IsPersonAccount is true.

Title.sfdc_description: Title of the contact, such as CEO or Vice President.

OwnerId.sfdc_description: The ID of the owner of the account associated with this contact.

CreatedById.sfdc_description:
CreatedById (Id of the User who created this Contact)
Id of User.

LastModifiedById.sfdc_description:
LastModifiedById (Id of the last User who modified this Contact)
Id of User.

LastActivityDate.sfdc_description: Value is the most recent of either: Due date of the most recent event logged against the record. Due date of the most recently closed task associated with the record.

LastViewedDate.sfdc_description: The timestamp when the current user last viewed this record or list view. If this value is null, the user might have only accessed this record or list view (LastReferencedDate) but not viewed it.

LastReferencedDate.sfdc_description: The timestamp when the current user last accessed this record, a record related to this record, or a list view.

EmailBouncedReason.sfdc_description: If bounce management is activated and an email sent to the contact bounces, the reason for the bounce.

EmailBouncedDate.sfdc_description: If bounce management is activated and an email sent to the contact bounces, the date and time of the bounce.

IsEmailBounced.sfdc_description: If bounce management is activated and an email is sent to a contact, indicates whether the email bounced (true) or not (false).

PhotoUrl.sfdc_description: Path to be combined with the URL of a Salesforce instance (Example: https://yourInstance.salesforce.com/) to generate a URL to request the social network profile image associated with the contact.

Jigsaw.sfdc_description: References the company’s ID in Data.com. If an account has a value in this field, it means that the account was imported from Data.com. If the field value is null, the account was not imported from Data.com.

IndividualId.sfdc_description: ID of the data privacy record associated with this contact. This field is available if Data Protection and Privacy is enabled.

ContactHistory.description: Represents the history of changes to the values in the fields of a contact.

CreatedById.sfdc_description:
CreatedById (Id of the User who created this ContactHistory)
Id of User.

Id.sfdc_description: Id (Id of Dated Currency Exchange Rates)

IsoCode.sfdc_description: The ISO code of the currency

ConversionRate.sfdc_description: Conversion rate of this currency type against the corporate currency (e.g. USD)

StartDate.sfdc_description: he date on which the effective dated exchange rate starts.

NextStartDate.sfdc_description: The date on which the next effective dated exchange rate will start. Effectively the day after the end date for this exchange rate.

WhoId.sfdc_description: The WhoId represents a human such as a lead or a contact. WhoIds are polymorphic. Polymorphic means a WhoId is equivalent to a contact’s ID or a lead’s ID. If Shared Activities is enabled, the value of this field is the ID of the related lead or primary contact. If you add, update, or remove the WhoId field, you might encounter problems with triggers, workflows, and data validation rules that are associated with the record. If the JunctionIdList field is used, all WhoIds are included in the relationship list. Beginning in API version 37.0, if the contact or lead ID in the WhoId field is not in the EventWhoIds list, no error occurs and the ID is added to the EventWhoIds as the primary WhoId. If WhoId is set to null, an arbitrary ID from the existing EventWhoIds list is promoted to the primary position.

WhatId.sfdc_description: The WhatId represents nonhuman objects such as accounts, opportunities, campaigns, cases, or custom objects. WhatIds are polymorphic. Polymorphic means a WhatId is equivalent to the ID of a related object.

Subject.sfdc_description: The subject line of the event, such as Call, Email, or Meeting.

Location.sfdc_description: Contains the location of the event.

IsAllDayEvent.sfdc_description: Indicates whether the ActivityDate field (true) or the ActivityDateTime field (false) is used to define the date or time of the event. See also DurationInMinutes and EndDateTime.

ActivityDateTime.sfdc_description: Contains the event’s due date if the IsAllDayEvent flag is set to false. The time portion of this field is always transferred in the Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) time zone. Translate the time portion to or from a local time zone for the user or the application, as appropriate. The value for this field and StartDateTime must match, or one of them must be null.

ActivityDate.sfdc_description: Contains the event’s due date if the IsAllDayEvent flag is set to true. This field is a date field with a timestamp that is always set to midnight in the Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) time zone. Don’t attempt to alter the timestamp to account for time zone differences. The value for this field and StartDateTime must match, or one of them must be null.

DurationInMinutes.sfdc_description: Contains the event length, in minutes. Even though this field represents a temporal value, it is an integer type—not a Date/Time type.

StartDateTime.sfdc_description: Indicates the start date and time of the event. If the Event IsAllDayEvent flag is set to true (indicating that it is an all-day Event), then the event start date information is contained in the StartDateTime field. The time portion of this field is always transferred in the Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) time zone. Translate the time portion to or from a local time zone for the user or the application, as appropriate. If the Event IsAllDayEvent flag is set to false (indicating that it is not an all-day event), then the event start date information is contained in the StartDateTime field. The time portion is always transferred in the Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) time zone. You need to translate the time portion to or from a local time zone for the user or the application, as appropriate. If this field has a value, then ActivityDate and ActivityDateTime must either be null or match the value of this field.

EndDateTime.sfdc_description: The time portion of this field is always transferred in the Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) time zone. Translate the time portion to or from a local time zone for the user or the application, as appropriate. This field is optional, depending on the following: If IsAllDayEvent is true, you can supply a value for either DurationInMinutes or EndDateTime. Supplying values in both fields is allowed if the values add up to the same amount of time. If both fields are null, the duration defaults to one day. If IsAllDayEvent is false, a value must be supplied for either DurationInMinutes or EndDateTime. Supplying values in both fields is allowed if the values add up to the same amount of time.Depending on your API version, errors with the DurationInMinutes and EndDateTime fields may appear in different places.

EndDate.sfdc_description: This field supplies the date value that appears in the EndDateTime field. This field is a date field with a timestamp that is always set to midnight in the Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) time zone.

Description.sfdc_description: Contains a text description of the event.

AccountId.sfdc_description: Represents the ID of the related account. The AccountId is determined as follows. If the value of WhatId is any of the following objects, then Salesforce uses that object’s AccountId. Account Opportunity Contract Custom object that is a child of Account If the value of the WhatId field is any other object, and the value of the WhoId field is a contact object, then Salesforce uses that contact’s AccountId. (If your org uses Shared Activities, Salesforce uses the AccountId of the primary contact.) Otherwise, Salesforce sets the value of the AccountId field to null.

OwnerId.sfdc_description: Contains the ID of the user or public calendar who owns the event.

CurrencyIsoCode.sfdc_description: Available only for organizations with the multicurrency feature enabled. Contains the ISO code for any currency allowed by the organization.

IsPrivate.sfdc_description: Indicates whether users other than the creator of the event can (false) or can’t (true) see the event details when viewing the event user’s calendar.

ShowAs.sfdc_description: Indicates how this event appears when another user views the calendar: Busy, Out of Office, or Free.

IsChild.sfdc_description: Indicates whether the event is a child of another event (true) or not (false).

IsGroupEvent.sfdc_description: Indicates whether the event is a group event—that is, whether it has invitees (true) or not (false).

CreatedById.sfdc_description:
CreatedById (Id of the User who created this Event)
Id of User.

LastModifiedById.sfdc_description:
LastModifiedById (Id of the last User who modified this Event)
Id of User.

RecurrenceActivityId.sfdc_description: Not required on create. Contains the ID of the main record of the Salesforce Classic recurring event. Subsequent occurrences have the same value in this field.

IsRecurrence.sfdc_description: Indicates whether a Salesforce Classic event is scheduled to repeat itself (true) or only occurs once (false).

RecurrenceStartDateTime.sfdc_description: Indicates the date and time when the Salesforce Classic recurring event begins. The value must precede the RecurrenceEndDateOnly. The time portion of this field is always transferred in the Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) time zone. Translate the time portion to or from a local time zone for the user or the application, as appropriate.

RecurrenceEndDateOnly.sfdc_description: Indicates the last date on which the event repeats. For multiday Salesforce Classic recurring events, this is the day on which the last occurrence starts. This field is a date field with a timestamp that is always set to midnight in the Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) time zone. Don’t attempt to alter the timestamp to account for time zone differences.

RecurrenceTimeZoneSidKey.sfdc_description: Indicates the time zone associated with a Salesforce Classic recurring event. For example, “UTC-8:00” for Pacific Standard Time.

RecurrenceType.sfdc_description: Indicates how often the Salesforce Classic event repeats. For example, daily, weekly, or every nth month (where “nth” is defined in RecurrenceInstance).

RecurrenceInterval.sfdc_description: Indicates the interval between Salesforce Classic recurring events.

RecurrenceDayOfWeekMask.sfdc_description: Indicates the day or days of the week on which the Salesforce Classic recurring event repeats. This field contains a bitmask. The values are as follows: Sunday = 1 Monday = 2 Tuesday = 4 Wednesday = 8 Thursday = 16 Friday = 32 Saturday = 64 Multiple days are represented as the sum of their numerical values. For example, Tuesday and Thursday = 4 + 16 = 20.

RecurrenceDayOfMonth.sfdc_description: Indicates the day of the month on which the event repeats.

RecurrenceInstance.sfdc_description: Indicates the frequency of the Salesforce Classic event’s recurrence. For example, 2nd or 3rd.

RecurrenceMonthOfYear.sfdc_description: Indicates the month in which the Salesforce Classic recurring event repeats.

ReminderDateTime.sfdc_description: Represents the time when the reminder is scheduled to fire, if IsReminderSet is set to true. If IsReminderSet is set to false, then the user may have deselected the reminder checkbox in the Salesforce user interface, or the reminder has already fired at the time indicated by the value.

IsReminderSet.sfdc_description: Indicates whether the activity is a reminder (true) or not (false).

EventSubtype.sfdc_description: Provides standard subtypes to facilitate creating and searching for events.

IsRecurrence2Exclusion.sfdc_description: Indicates when updates to a Lightning Experience event series recurrence pattern have been made, but affect future event occurrences only. For past event occurrences, IsRecurrence2Exclusion is set to true, excluding past occurrences from the series recurrence pattern.

Recurrence2PatternText.sfdc_description: Indicates the recurrence pattern for Lightning Experience event series. Recurrence2PatternText is implemented with RFC 5545 standard specifications for internet calendaring and scheduling. See Event Series section in this topic for usage examples.

Recurrence2PatternVersion.sfdc_description: Indicates the standard specifications for Lightning Experience event series recurrence patterns. The only possible value is 1 (RFC 5545 v4 RRULE)—RFC 5545 is a standard set of specifications for internet calendaring and scheduling that IsRecurrence2 adheres to for series recurrence patterns. RFC 5545 specifications for series recurrence patterns are called rrules.

IsRecurrence2.sfdc_description: Indicates whether a Lightning Experience event is scheduled to repeat (true) or only occurs once (false. If this field value is true, then Recurrence2PatternText and Recurrence2PatternVersion must be populated.

IsRecurrence2Exception.sfdc_description: Indicates whether an individual event in a Lightning Experience event series has a recurrence pattern that’s different from the rest of the series, making it an exception.

Recurrence2PatternStartDate.sfdc_description: Indicates the date and time when the Lightning Experience event series begins. The time portion of this field is always transferred in the Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) time zone. Translate the time portion to or from a local time zone for the user or the application, as appropriate.

Recurrence2PatternTimeZone.sfdc_description: Indicates the time zone in which the Lightning Experience event series was created or updated. This field uses standard Java TimeZone IDs. For example, America/Los_Angeles.

MasterRecordId.sfdc_description: Do not use this column unless dealing with deleted records. If this record was deleted as the result of a merge, this field contains the ID of the record that was kept. If this record was deleted for any other reason, or has not been deleted, the value is null.When using Apex triggers to determine which record was deleted in a merge event, this field’s value is the ID of the record that remains in Trigger.old. In Trigger.new, the value is null.

Name.sfdc_description: Concatenation of FirstName, MiddleName, LastName, and Suffix.

RecordTypeId.sfdc_description: ID of the record type assigned to this object.

Title.sfdc_description: Title for the lead, such as CFO or CEO.

Company.sfdc_description: The lead’s company. If person account record types have been enabled, and if the value of Company is null, the lead converts to a person account.

Street.sfdc_description: Street number and name for the address of the lead.

State.sfdc_description: State for the address of the lead.

PostalCode.sfdc_description: Postal code for the address of the lead.

Latitude.sfdc_description: Used with Longitude to specify the precise geolocation of an address.

Longitude.sfdc_description: Used with Latitude to specify the precise geolocation of an address.

GeocodeAccuracy.sfdc_description: Accuracy level of the geocode for the address. For details on geolocation compound fields, see .

PhotoUrl.sfdc_description: Path to be combined with the URL of a Salesforce instance (Example: https://yourInstance.salesforce.com/) to generate a URL to request the social network profile image associated with the lead. Generated URL returns an HTTP redirect (code 302) to the social network profile image for the lead. Empty if Social Accounts and Contacts isn't enabled or if Social Accounts and Contacts has been disabled for the requesting user.

Status.sfdc_description: Status code for this converted lead. Status codes are defined in Status and represented in the API by the LeadStatus object.

Industry.sfdc_description: Industry in which the lead works.

CurrencyIsoCode.sfdc_description: Available only for organizations with the multicurrency feature enabled. Contains the ISO code for any currency allowed by the organization.

AnnualRevenue.sfdc_description: Estimated annual revenue of the account. This is NOT OUR REVENUE made with the account! Do not use this field unless you explicitly need to use the amount of money the account makes as a business for themselves.

NumberOfEmployees.sfdc_description: Number of employees at the lead’s company.

IsConverted.sfdc_description: Indicates whether the lead has been converted (true) or not (false).

ConvertedDate.sfdc_description: Date on which this lead was converted.

ConvertedAccountId.sfdc_description: Object reference ID that points to the account into which the lead converted.

ConvertedContactId.sfdc_description: Object reference ID that points to the contact into which the lead converted.

ConvertedOpportunityId.sfdc_description: Object reference ID that points to the opportunity into which the lead has been converted.

IsUnreadByOwner.sfdc_description: If true, lead has been assigned, but not yet viewed. See Unread Leads for more information.

CreatedById.sfdc_description:
CreatedById (Id of the User who created this Lead)
Id of User.

LastModifiedById.sfdc_description:
LastModifiedById (Id of the last User who modified this Lead)
Id of User.

LastActivityDate.sfdc_description: Value is the most recent of either: Due date of the most recent event logged against the record. Due date of the most recently closed task associated with the record.

LastViewedDate.sfdc_description: The timestamp when the current user last viewed this record or list view. If this value is null, the user might have only accessed this record or list view (LastReferencedDate) but not viewed it.

LastReferencedDate.sfdc_description: The timestamp when the current user last accessed this record, a record related to this record, or a list view.

Jigsaw.sfdc_description: References the ID of a contact in Data.com. If a lead has a value in this field, it means that a contact was imported as a lead from Data.com. If the contact (converted to a lead) was not imported from Data.com, the field value is null.

EmailBouncedReason.sfdc_description: If bounce management is activated and an email sent to the lead bounced, the reason for the bounce.

EmailBouncedDate.sfdc_description: If bounce management is activated and an email sent to the lead bounced, the date and time of the bounce.

IndividualId.sfdc_description: ID of the data privacy record associated with this lead. This field is available if you enabled Data Protection and Privacy in Setup.

DeveloperName.sfdc_description: The unique name of the object in the API.

IsActive.sfdc_description: Indicates whether the Record Type is in active.

Description.sfdc_description: The unique name of the object in the API.

LastModifiedById.sfdc_description:
LastModifiedById (Id of the last User who modified this Record Type)
Id of User.

AccountId.sfdc_description: ID of the account associated with this opportunity.

RecordTypeId.sfdc_description: ID of the record type assigned to this object.

StageName.sfdc_description: Current stage of this record. The StageName field controls several other fields on an opportunity. Each of the fields can be directly set or implied by changing the StageName field. In addition, the StageName field is a picklist, so it has additional members in the returned describeSObjectResult to indicate how it affects the other fields. To obtain the stage name values in the picklist, query the OpportunityStage object. If the StageName is updated, then the ForecastCategoryName, IsClosed, IsWon, and Probability are automatically updated based on the stage-category mapping.

Amount.sfdc_description: Estimated total sale amount. For opportunities with products, the amount is the sum of the related products. Any attempt to update this field, if the record has products, will be ignored. The update call will not be rejected, and other fields will be updated as specified, but the Amount will be unchanged.

Probability.sfdc_description: Percentage of estimated confidence in closing the opportunity. It is implied, but not directly controlled, by the StageName field. You can override this field to a different value than what is implied by the StageName.

CloseDate.sfdc_description: Date when the opportunity is expected to close.

Type.sfdc_description: Type of opportunity. For example, Existing Business or New Business.

NextStep.sfdc_description: Description of next task in closing opportunity.

LeadSource.sfdc_description: Source of this opportunity, such as Advertisement or Trade Show.

IsClosed.sfdc_description: Directly controlled by StageName. You can query and filter on this field, but you can’t directly set it in a create, upsert, or update request. It can only be set via StageName.

IsWon.sfdc_description: Directly controlled by StageName. You can query and filter on this field, but you can’t directly set the value. It can only be set via StageName.

ForecastCategory.sfdc_description: Restricted picklist field. It is implied, but not directly controlled, by the StageName field. You can override this field to a different value than is implied by the StageName value. The values of this field are fixed enumerated values.

ForecastCategoryName.sfdc_description: The name of the forecast category. It is implied, but not directly controlled, by the StageName field. You can override this field to a different value than is implied by the StageName value.

CurrencyIsoCode.sfdc_description: Available only for organizations with the multicurrency feature enabled. Contains the ISO code for any currency allowed by the organization.

CampaignId.sfdc_description: ID of a related Campaign. This field is defined only for those organizations that have the campaign feature Campaigns enabled. The User must have read access rights to the cross-referenced Campaign object in order to create or update that campaign into this field on the opportunity.

HasOpportunityLineItem.sfdc_description: Read-only field that indicates whether the opportunity has associated line items. A value of true means that Opportunity line items have been created for the opportunity. An opportunity can have opportunity line items only if the opportunity has a price book. The opportunity line items must correspond to PricebookEntry objects that are listed in the opportunity Pricebook2. However, you can insert opportunity line items on an opportunity that does not have an associated Pricebook2. For the first opportunity line item that you insert on an opportunity without a Pricebook2, the API automatically sets the Pricebook2Id field, if the opportunity line item corresponds to a PricebookEntry in an active Pricebook2 that has a CurrencyIsoCode field that matches the CurrencyIsoCode field of the opportunity. If the Pricebook2 is not active or the CurrencyIsoCode fields do not match, then the API returns an error. You can’t update the Pricebook2Id or PricebookId fields if opportunity line items exist on the Opportunity. You must delete the line items before attempting to update the PricebookId field.

Pricebook2Id.sfdc_description: ID of a related Pricebook2 object. The Pricebook2Id field indicates which Pricebook2 applies to this opportunity. The Pricebook2Id field is defined only for those organizations that have products enabled as a feature. You can specify values for only one field (Pricebook2Id or PricebookId)—not both fields. For this reason, both fields are declared nillable.

OwnerId.sfdc_description: ID of the User who has been assigned to work this opportunity.

CreatedById.sfdc_description:
CreatedById (Id of the User who created this Opportunity)
Id of User.

LastModifiedById.sfdc_description:
LastModifiedById (Id of the last User who modified this Opportunity)
Id of User.

LastActivityDate.sfdc_description: Value is one of the following, whichever is the most recent: Due date of the most recent event logged against the record. Due date of the most recently closed task associated with the record.

FiscalQuarter.sfdc_description: Represents the fiscal quarter. Valid values are 1, 2, 3, or 4.

FiscalYear.sfdc_description: Represents the fiscal year, for example, 2006.

Fiscal.sfdc_description: If fiscal years are not enabled, the name of the fiscal quarter or period in which the opportunity CloseDate falls. Value should be in YYY Q format, for example, '2006 1' for first quarter of 2006.

ContactId.sfdc_description: ID of the contact associated with this opportunity, set as the primary contact. Read-only field that is derived from the opportunity contact role, which is created at the same time the opportunity is created. This field can only be populated when it’s created, and can’t be updated.

LastViewedDate.sfdc_description: The timestamp when the current user last viewed this record or list view. If this value is null, the user might have only accessed this record or list view (LastReferencedDate) but not viewed it.

LastReferencedDate.sfdc_description: The timestamp when the current user last accessed this record, a record related to this record, or a list view.

HasOpenActivity.sfdc_description: Indicates whether an opportunity has an open event or task (true) or not (false).

HasOverdueTask.sfdc_description: Indicates whether an opportunity has an overdue task (true) or not (false).

LastAmountChangedHistoryId.sfdc_description: ID of the OpportunityHistory record that contains information about when the opportunity Amount field was last updated in Winter ’21 or later. Information includes the date and time of the change and the user who made the change.

LastCloseDateChangedHistoryId.sfdc_description: ID of the OpportunityHistory record that contains information about when the opportunity Close Date field was last updated. Information includes the date and time of the change and the user who made the change.

OpportunityHistory.description: Represents the stage history of an opportunity.

CreatedById.sfdc_description:
CreatedById (Id of the User who created this OpportunityHistory)
Id of User.

StageName.sfdc_description: Name of the current stage of the opportunity (for example, Prospect or Proposal).

ExpectedRevenue.sfdc_description: Calculated revenue based on the Amount and Probability fields.

CloseDate.sfdc_description: Date when the opportunity is expected to close.

Probability.sfdc_description: Percentage of estimated confidence in closing the opportunity.

ForecastCategory.sfdc_description: Category that determines the column in which an opportunity is totaled in a forecast.

PrevAmount.sfdc_description: The value in the opportunity’s Amount field before the update of the opportunity.In OpportunityHistory records created before Winter ’21, the value is null.

PrevCloseDate.sfdc_description: The value in the opportunity’s Close Date field before the update of the opportunity.In OpportunityHistory records created before Winter ’21, the value is null.

Task.description: Represents a business activity such as making a phone call or other to-do items. In the user interface, Task and Event records are collectively referred to as activities.

WhoId.sfdc_description: The WhoId represents a human such as a lead or a contact.

WhatId.sfdc_description: The WhatId represents nonhuman objects such as accounts, opportunities, campaigns, cases, or custom objects.

Subject.sfdc_description: The subject line of the task.

ActivityDate.sfdc_description: Represents the due date of the task. This field has a timestamp that is always set to midnight in the Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) time zone. The timestamp is not relevant; do not attempt to alter it to accommodate time zone differences. This field can’t be set or updated for a recurring task (IsRecurrence is true).

Status.sfdc_description: The status of the task, such as In Progress or Completed. Each predefined Status field implies a value for the IsClosed flag. To obtain picklist values, query the TaskStatus object.This field can’t be updated for recurring tasks (IsRecurrence is true).

Priority.sfdc_description: Indicates the importance or urgency of a task, such as high or low.

IsHighPriority.sfdc_description: Indicates a high-priority task. This field is derived from the Priority field.

OwnerId.sfdc_description: ID of the User or Group who owns the record. This field accepts Groups of type Queue only. In the user interface, Group IDs correspond with the queue’s list view names.

Description.sfdc_description: Contains a text description of the task.

AccountId.sfdc_description: Represents the ID of the related Account. The AccountId is determined as follows. If the value of WhatId is any of the following objects, then Salesforce uses that object’s AccountId. Account Opportunity Contract Custom object that is a child of Account If the value of the WhatIdfield is any other object, and the value of the WhoId field is a Contact object, then Salesforce uses that contact’s AccountId. (If your organization uses Shared Activities, then Salesforce uses the AccountId of the primary contact.) Otherwise, Salesforce sets the value of the AccountId field to null. For information on IDs, see ID Field Type.

IsClosed.sfdc_description: Indicates whether the task has been completed (true) or not (false). Is only set indirectly via the Status picklist.

CreatedById.sfdc_description:
CreatedById (Id of the User who created this Task)
Id of User.

LastModifiedById.sfdc_description:
LastModifiedById (Id of the last User who modified this Task)
Id of User.

CallDurationInSeconds.sfdc_description: Duration of the call in seconds.

CallType.sfdc_description: The type of call being answered: Inbound, Internal, or Outbound.

CallDisposition.sfdc_description: Represents the result of a given call.

ReminderDateTime.sfdc_description: Represents the time when the reminder is scheduled to fire, if IsReminderSet is set to true. If IsReminderSet is set to false, then the user may have deselected the reminder checkbox in the Salesforce user interface, or the reminder has already fired at the time indicated by the value.

IsReminderSet.sfdc_description: Indicates whether a popup reminder has been set for the task (true) or not (false).

RecurrenceActivityId.sfdc_description: Not required on create. ID of the main record of the recurring task. Subsequent occurrences have the same value in this field.

IsRecurrence.sfdc_description: Indicates whether the task is scheduled to repeat itself (true) or only occurs once (false). If this field value is true, then RecurrenceStartDateOnly, RecurrenceEndDateOnly, RecurrenceType, and any recurrence fields associated with the given recurrence type must be populated. See Recurring Tasks.

RecurrenceStartDateOnly.sfdc_description: The date when the recurring task begins. Must be a date and time before RecurrenceEndDateOnly.

RecurrenceEndDateOnly.sfdc_description: The last date on which the task repeats. This field has a timestamp that is always set to midnight in the Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) time zone. The timestamp is not relevant; do not attempt to alter it to accommodate time zone differences.

RecurrenceTimeZoneSidKey.sfdc_description: The time zone associated with the recurring task. For example, “UTC-8:00” for Pacific Standard Time.

RecurrenceType.sfdc_description: Indicates how often the task repeats. For example, daily, weekly, or every nth month (where “nth” is defined in RecurrenceInstance).

RecurrenceDayOfWeekMask.sfdc_description: The day or days of the week on which the task repeats. This field contains a bitmask. The values are as follows: Sunday = 1 Monday = 2 Tuesday = 4 Wednesday = 8 Thursday = 16 Friday = 32 Saturday = 64 Multiple days are represented as the sum of their numerical values. For example, Tuesday and Thursday = 4 + 16 = 20.

RecurrenceDayOfMonth.sfdc_description: The day of the month in which the task repeats.

RecurrenceInstance.sfdc_description: The frequency of the recurring task.

RecurrenceMonthOfYear.sfdc_description: The month of the year in which the task repeats.

RecurrenceRegeneratedType.sfdc_description: Represents what triggers a repeating task to repeat. Add this field to a page layout together with the RecurrenceInterval field, which determines the number of days between the triggering date (due date or close date) and the due date of the next repeating task in the series.

TaskSubtype.sfdc_description: Provides standard subtypes to facilitate creating and searching for specific task subtypes.

CompletedDateTime.sfdc_description: The date and time the task was saved with a Closed status. For insert, if the task is saved with a Closed status the field is set. If the task is saved with an Open status the field is set to NULL. For update, if the task is saved with a new Closed status, the field is reset. If the task is saved with a new non-closed status, the field is reset to NULL. If the task is saved with the same closed status (that is, unchanged) there is no change to the field. The status is a dynamic enum. If the Closed mapping is changed it won’t cause an update of existing tasks. Only new insert/update operations are affected.

User.description: Represents a user/employee in your organization.

Username.sfdc_description: Contains the name that a user enters to log in to the API or the user interface. The value for this field must be in the form of an email address. It must also be unique across all organizations.

CompanyName.sfdc_description: The name of the user’s company.

Division.sfdc_description: The division associated with this user, similar to Department and unrelated to DefaultDivision.

Department.sfdc_description: The company department associated with the user.

Title.sfdc_description: The user’s business title, such as “Vice President.”

Street.sfdc_description: The street address associated with the User.

City.sfdc_description: The city associated with the user.

State.sfdc_description: The state associated with the User.

PostalCode.sfdc_description: The user’s postal or ZIP code.

Country.sfdc_description: The country associated with the user.

Latitude.sfdc_description: Used with Longitude to specify the precise geolocation of an address.

Longitude.sfdc_description: Used with Latitude to specify the precise geolocation of an address.

GeocodeAccuracy.sfdc_description: The level of accuracy of a location’s geographical coordinates compared with its physical address. A geocoding service typically provides this value based on the address’s latitude and longitude coordinates.

EmailPreferencesAutoBcc.sfdc_description: Determines whether the user receives copies of sent emails. This option applies only if compliance BCC emails are not enabled.

SenderEmail.sfdc_description: The email address used as the From address when the user sends emails.

SenderName.sfdc_description: The name used as the email sender when the user sends emails.

Signature.sfdc_description: The signature text added to emails.

MobilePhone.sfdc_description: The user’s mobile or cellular phone number.

Alias.sfdc_description: The user’s alias. For example, jsmith.

CommunityNickname.sfdc_description: Name used to identify this user in the Experience Cloud site.

BadgeText.sfdc_description: The Experience Cloud site role, displayed on the user profile page just below the user name.

IsActive.sfdc_description: Indicates whether the user has access to log in (true) or not (false). You can modify a User's active status from the user interface or via the API.

TimeZoneSidKey.sfdc_description: This field is a restricted picklist field. A User time zone affects the offset used when displaying or entering times in the user interface. However, the API does not use a User time zone when querying or setting values. Values for this field are named using region and key city, according to ISO standards.

LocaleSidKey.sfdc_description: This field is a restricted picklist field. The value of the field affects formatting and parsing of values, especially numeric values, in the user interface. The field values are named according to the language, and country if necessary, using two-letter ISO codes. The set of names is based on the ISO standard.

possible_values.value_label: Chinese (Hong Kong SAR China, Stroke Ordering)

ReceivesInfoEmails.sfdc_description: Indicates whether the user receives informational email from Salesforce (true) or not (false).

ReceivesAdminInfoEmails.sfdc_description: Indicates whether the user receives email for administrators from Salesforce (true) or not (false).

EmailEncodingKey.sfdc_description: The email encoding for the user, such as ISO-8859-1 or UTF-8.

DefaultCurrencyIsoCode.sfdc_description: The user's default currency setting for new records. For example, a user in France could have a DefaultCurrencyIsoCode set to Euros, and that would be their default currency in the application. Only applicable for organizations that use multiple currencies.

ProfileId.sfdc_description: ID of the user’s Profile. Use this value to cache metadata based on profile. In earlier releases, this was RoleId.

LanguageLocaleKey.sfdc_description: The user’s language, such as “French” or “Chinese (Traditional).”

DelegatedApproverId.sfdc_description: Id of the user who is a delegated approver for this user.

ManagerId.sfdc_description: The Id of the user who manages this user.

LastLoginDate.sfdc_description: The date and time when the user last successfully logged in. This value is updated if 60 seconds have elapsed since the user’s last login.

CreatedById.sfdc_description:
CreatedById (Id of the User who created this User)
Id of another User.

LastModifiedById.sfdc_description:
LastModifiedById (Id of the last User who modified this User)
Id of another User.

OfflineTrialExpirationDate.sfdc_description: The date and time when the user’s Connect Offline trial expires.

ForecastEnabled.sfdc_description: Indicates whether the user is enabled as a forecast manager (true) or not (false). Forecast managers see forecast rollups from users below them in the forecast hierarchy.

ContactId.sfdc_description: ID of the Contact associated with this account. The contact must have a value in the AccountId field or an error occurs.

AccountId.sfdc_description: ID of the Account associated with a Customer Portal user. This field is null for Salesforce users.

CallCenterId.sfdc_description: If Salesforce CRM Call Center is enabled, represents the call center to which this user is assigned.

FederationIdentifier.sfdc_description: Indicates the value that must be listed in the Subject element of a Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML) IDP certificate to authenticate the user for a client application using single sign-on. This value must be specified if the SAML User ID Type is Assertion contains Federation ID from the User record. Otherwise, this field can’t be edited.

AboutMe.sfdc_description: Information about the user, such as areas of interest or skills. This field is available even if Chatter is disabled.

FullPhotoUrl.sfdc_description: The URL for the user's profile photo. This field is available even if Chatter is disabled. The URL is updated every time a photo is uploaded and reflects the most recent photo. If a newer photo has been uploaded, the URL returned for an older photo is not guaranteed to return a photo. Query this field for the URL of the most recent photo.

SmallPhotoUrl.sfdc_description: The URL for a thumbnail of the user's profile photo. This field is available even if Chatter is disabled. The URL is updated every time a photo is uploaded and reflects the most recent photo. If a newer photo has been uploaded, the URL returned for an older photo is not guaranteed to return a photo. Query this field for the URL of the most recent photo.

DigestFrequency.sfdc_description: The frequency at which the system sends the user’s Chatter personal email digest.

DefaultGroupNotificationFrequency.field_label: Default Notification Frequency when Joining Groups
DefaultGroupNotificationFrequency.sfdc_description: The default frequency for sending the user's Chatter group email notifications when the user joins groups.

LastViewedDate.sfdc_description: The timestamp for when the current user last viewed this record. If this value is null, this record might only have been referenced (LastReferencedDate) and not viewed.

LastReferencedDate.sfdc_description: The timestamp for when the current user last viewed a record related to this record.

BannerPhotoUrl.sfdc_description: The URL for the user's banner photo.

SmallBannerPhotoUrl.sfdc_description: The URL for the small user profile banner photo.

MediumBannerPhotoUrl.sfdc_description: The URL for the medium-sized user profile banner photo.

IsProfilePhotoActive.sfdc_description: Indicates whether a user has a profile photo (true) or not (false).

IndividualId.sfdc_description: ID of the data privacy record associated with this user. This field is available if Data Protection and Privacy is enabled.
